notesStmt.note: Written by The Pentateuch was punctuated by R. Samuel bar Abraham of Molerstadt : mentioned in a marginal note as the punctuator (folio 96r); inscribed with his name in a colophon as the punctuator who punctuated the codex 'until this point' within six weeks, Sunday, beginning of Kislev, folio 112v; mentioned as punctuator of the Pentateuch who punctuated it in Babenberg, colophon at the end of the codex, dated 1396, folio 252r.The Five Scrolls, the Haftarot and the grammatical treatise were punctuated by R.Gershom bar Judah in Rödelsee, colophon at the end of the codex, dated 1396, folio 252r. Obituary entries: death of a later owner's parents (Bittingen, 1535, and Wallerstein, 1539) (folio 252r). Alexander ben Solomon Zalman Kohen: inscribed with his name, 1750, folio 1r. Illegible Hebrew inscriptions, folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Pentateuch, Five Scrolls, Hafṭarot accompanied by masorah magna, masorah parva and grammatical treatises (aka the 'Coburg Pentateuch').

msItem.title: Torah, megilot ṿe-hafṭarot תורה, מגילות והפטרות
A collection of several pieces on masorah, punctuation and accents.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in pencil can be found also in the outer lower corner of recto sides, hardly visible.

collation.p: 32 quires of mostly 8 leaves, apart from two consisting of 6 leaves. Vertical catchwords at the end of quires, decorated.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script of the 13th century; punctuation provided by two different hands. R. Simḥah bar Shemu᾿el ha-Levi: mentioned in the colophon at the end of the Pentateuch, Monday 21, Adar Sheni, 1395, folio 169v; also mentioned as scribe in the colophon at the end of the codex, Coburg, 1396, folio 252r; the word שמחה is decorated several times (e.g. 17v, 112v, 126v, 131v, 132r, 154v, 184v).
